inn1.comm: tossed up from round the wicket, pitched up and that is pushed towards cover
keeps it up to the batsman, blocked down the track towards the bowler
sticks around the off stump, defended off the back foot after getting behind the line
length ball on the pads, flicked towards mid-on, can't beat the fielder
a bit of flight there, pitched up and on the pads, pushed towards mid-on for a single
wheels away around off stump, watchful defence off the front foot
Morkel starts round the wicket, and sprays one well wide of off stump, I thought that should have been called a wide, but the umpire doesn't
again well outside off, not as wide as the previous one, Tharanga leaves this 146.4kph delivery alone
Morkel tries his luck miles outside off again, this time the umpire calls it a wide, he's getting the ball to seam away quite a bit here
on a length and closer to the stumps, another leave
again getting the ball to jag away a long way, starts too far outside off to worry the batsman though
length ball heading for off stump this time, fuller than the previous deliveries this over, defended towards midwicket
short of length ball outside off, enough room for Tharanga to slash it behind backward point, that's a favourite scoring area for Tharanga
Morkel over the wicket to the right-hander, again seemed very close to being a wide outside off, umpire doesn't call it though
Peterson is excited as Tharanga steps down the track and chips the ball just wide of the diving midwicket fielder
length ball on off stump, Peterson flighting the ball, Dilshan will go for it, he drives crisply but straight to cover
gets well forward and defends to the off side
length ball, extra bounce for Peterson, Dilshan is a bit surprised by that one, hits higher on the blade than he wanted as he defended
opens the face and steers the ball towards backward point
a slog from Dilshan to get going, it was well outside off, Dilshan plays an ungainly pull towards deep midwicket
short of a length ball on leg stump, defended towards square leg
length ball from over the wicket, on middle stump, driven towards cover

a spectacular catch gets the first wicket, a short ball from Morkel, Tharanga is hurried into the pull, doesn't time the ball at all, it loops towards midwicket where Peterson runs back and dives to send back Tharanga for another low score
another shortish ball, 146kph, pulled away towards square leg by dilshan
on the pads, Sangakkara gets his first run by clipping the ball towards fine leg
Dilshan hasn't looked comfortable so far, again here he tries to leave a length ball outside off but is late to raise his bat, that 142kph delivery thuds against his bat and bounces towards slip
Morris starts with a gentle delivery sliding across outside off, left alone
too wide outside off, the angle is taking the ball away from the batsman, and Morris starts too far outside off
Morris grunts as he sends down a 133.8kph ball, pitched up and a lot closer to off stump, Sangakkara shoulders arms
length ball on the pads, pushed towards mid-on by Sangakkara
strays on the pads one more, superbly dealt with by Sangakkara, a mere flick, no power whatsoever, but the timing was terrific, even on this slow outfield, the ball runs away to the rope
length ball angling across Sangakkara, who is happy to allow it through to the keeper
pitched up and just outside off, punched off the front foot towards mid-off

awesome effort from David Miller to pluck that one at square leg, just landed short of the diving Miller, again it is the short, quick ball from Morkel that is causing the problems, Dilshan's pull doesn't even send the ball outside the ring
length ball on off, watchful defence from Sangakkara

pacy delivery from Morkel, who is getting the ball to jag away quite a bit, this one started just outside off and moves away a lot, too far from the off for the umpire's liking, Morkel is disappointed at the call
can't be disappointed at this being called a wide, much too far outside off
Morkel switches to round the wicket, fires it in full, another of those delightful flicks from Sangakkara, who places it wide of midwicket for a boundary
inside-edge onto the pad, the ball rolls towards midwicket, this was a short of length ball angling in
poor line from over the wicket this time, length ball and on the pads, helped along to fine leg for a couple
full and just outside off, Sangakkara opens the face as he steers that towards point, Sangakkara looking very comfortable in the middle, unlike Dilshan who is struggling
full ball angling into the leg stump, clipped towards midwicket, a diving stop by Duminy
shorter this time, just outside off, Sangakkara defends it towards point
short of length ball outside off, angling across and that is left alone
length ball on off stump, 137kph, defended off the front foot to the right of the bowler
full and well outside off, square driven towards deep backward point, Morkel has to gallop across from third man, a bit of a fumble there
firmly driven towards cover for a single
a shot that we saw a lot of in the previous game, a shortish ball from over the wicket, Sangakkara gets on the back foot and calmly pulls that away to the square-leg boundary
length ball well outside off, slapped towards point
length ball on the pads, defended down the pitch
looking to glance that one towards fine leg, Sangakkara shuffles across but can't connect, off the pads to the keeper
short of length and outside off, wide enough for Sangakkara to crack it towards point, can't beat the fielder there though
much too wide down the leg side, that's a poor delivery, the camera immediately pans to the bowling coach Allan Donald
once again Sangakkara looking to guide the ball down to fine leg, again he can't connect and it is off the pads towards fine leg
full length ball outside off, driven towards point off the front foot
length ball outside off, mistimed drive towards cover
pitched up and that is driven crisply towards mid-off
back of a length ball outside off, Sangakkara gets on the backfoot and chops it towards cover
a thick edge, Sangakkara survives as that flies through gully for four, it was a fullish ball just outside off that Sangakkara wanted to drive through the off side
on middle and leg, driven crisply towards mid-on by Sangakkara
length ball at 136.5kph, Dilshan hasn't had too much strike in recent over, he defends this towards mid-on
full ball is whipped towards midwicket, placement not very good though

could have been some major drama there, as McLaren got in the way of Sangakkara when he was looking to field the ball, Dilshan had pushed the ball towards mid-on and wanted a quick single, they complete it without trouble though, a direct hit at the keeper's end would have made it interesting
a firm drive towards mid-off, McLaren getting his radar on target now
angling across Sangakkara who allows it through to the keeper
full ball outside off, driven crisply towards cover
short of length ball well outside off, cut towards cover from Dilshan
outside of from Phangiso and that is worked past point
flighted full ball, driven back to the bowler, who dives to his left to stop that
goes for the sweep and he misses, good flight there from Phangiso
Sangakkara pushes this towards long-on for an easy single
Dilshan waits on the back foot though that was a full delivery, look to cut and he misses that, Phangiso has begun well here
McLaren  starts the over with a length ball on the pads, clipped to midwicket
sees Sangakkara charging out, McLaren bangs it in short, Sangakkara was several paces out of the crease but could only duck out of the way
pitched up and that is driven towards extra cover, a couple of fielders dive in vain before a third cuts it off
full and well wide outside off, the ball moves away a touch as well, Dilshan looks to steer that to point before aborting the stroke midway through
length ball coming in towards the off stump, nice and accurate from McLaren, Dilshan happy to defend
a 143.4kph bouncer, Dilshan goes for the pull but doesn't connect properly, a bit of a top edge as the ball swirls down to fine leg
a touch short and outside off, uses the pace of the ball to guide it towards the third man boundary
length ball is defended back towards the bowler, Phangiso happy to flight the ball here
length ball spinning away, pushed off the back foot towards cover
goes for a powerful sweep but he can't connect properly, the ball loops over the keeper's head
skips down the track and punches the ball towards long-on
length ball is driven towards extra cover by Sangakkara
pitched up, just outside off, driven towards sweeper cover
short ball on leg stump, Sangakkara ducks under
length ball on off stump, blocked off the front foot
McLaren keeping it steady here, pitching it up and Sangakkara gets a thick inside-edge on to the pads
some noise as the ball goes through to the keeper down the leg side, brushes Sangakkara's thigh pad before reaching de Villiers, loud appeal for caught-behind
connects well this time as he pulls the ball down towards fine leg
spins in from outside off, Sangakkara's attempts a risky lap sweep from outside off, off the pads and over the keeper
skips down the track to get to the pitch of the ball and launches that powerfully over midwicket for a boundary,
full and on off, driven back towards the bowler
takes a couple of steps down the track to drive the ball towards long-on for a single
a flighted delivery from Phangiso, driven towards long-off for a single
full ball well outside off, driven towards deep point for a single
short of length ball just outside off, slapped past cover for a single
shortish ball well outside off, Dilshan chases after that one but fresh-airs it, lucky for him there's no edge, as always Dilshan went really hard at it
on middle stump, Dilshan uses his wrists and tucks the ball to midwicket
short of length and angling in, 141.8kph, Dilshan swivels as he pulls it towards deep square leg
length ball on off stump, Sangakkara gets behind the line and defends it back towards the bowler
short of length ball outside off, slapped towards cover off the back foot
length ball on middle and leg, Dilshan gets well back and turns the ball towards square leg
full ball outside off, driven towards cover
lovely placement there from Sangakkara, waits on the back foot for that one to arrive, then plays it late, steering it wide of backward point
gets on the front foot and drives towards cover
gets forward and drives towards backward point this time, gets a single
well outside off, Dilshan chases it and gets a thick edge past the keeper towards third man
driven to the left of the bowler, Phangiso dives to get his hands on that one
gives it plenty of air, pitched up and that is driven towards the bowler
once more, plenty of flight, pitched up and another push back to the bowler
on a length again, Sangakkara skips down the track and punches back towards the bowler

Phangiso's decision to keep flighting the ball pays off, once again Sangakkara skips down the track but the ball is too wide for him to properly control it, he whacks it anyway but can't clear extra cover, a rare unwise stroke from Sangakkara, and South Africa have got a huge wicket here
full ball, an inside-out drive towards sweeper cover gets Jayawardene off the mark
Peterson's back and he starts with a wonderful delivery that spins away after pitching on off, Mahela is beaten
follows it up with a full toss, lucky to get away with that one, Mahela thrashes it to mid-on but can't beat the man there
Mahela gets well back in the crease and carves that towards point
easy single this time, driven towards long-off
gets well forward and defends, an inside-edge onto the pads
poor ball to start from Phangiso, down the leg side, Mahela looks to sweep that but misses
flighted and full, Mahela opens the face to guide the ball towards point
reverse-swept to first slip, does he play this shot this early in the innings? not off the middle off the bat
driven towards extra cover this time
and again Phangiso misses his line, way down the leg side, de Villiers can't collect, Mahela can't connect
eased towards cover for a single
this one holds its line, doesn't spin away as Dilshan expected, he manages to defend that off the back foot
well outside off this time, lucky to get away with that one, Dilshan slaps it to a diving backward point
Mahela waits for that to arrive and deflects it towards point
flighted and full, a typically full-blooded drive from Dilshan towards point
another full ball, a lofted drive towards long-off, bounces a few times before reaching the fielder
slapped towards sweeper cover, singles coming easy here
full toss and that is guided towards deep extra cover for two more
flighted once more, Mahela happy to block off the front foot
gets a thick outside edge as he looks to play that off the back foot, through the vacant slip area
lot of air again from Phangiso, defended by Mahela
looks to sweep this full ball, struck on the pad outside off
uses the width to slap that one towards point
on middle and leg, defended from the crease towards the bowler
well outside off, chopped towards sweeper cover
length ball on off stump, Dilshan works that towards point
full toss on off stump, whipped towards midwicket but can't beat the fielder, that ball should have been put away for four
chips this towards long-off, didn't hit it with too much power
well outside off, slapped towards backward point
gets forward and defends towards point
drags this short, a poor ball from Peterson, muscled towards deep midwicket
a short of length ball, Dilshan waits on the back foot and stabs that past backward point
slapped towards deep point for a single
full ball on leg stump, looks to hammer that over square leg, can't time it properly or place it well enough
a wide down the leg side, plenty of freebies from South Africa today
length ball on leg stump, Dilshan defends watchfully
flighted ball spins away after pitching outside off, slapped in front of point
more flight from Phangiso, some width on offer, Mahela waits on the back foot and caresses that behind point for four, nicely done
defended back to the bowler, how long before a crazy shot from Dilshan?
punched towards sweeper cover to bring up Sri Lanka's 100
gets forward and opens the face to steer the ball towards point
too wide outside off, powered towards deep point
beautiful delivery, drifts in and then spins away, pitching on a length on off stump before beating Mahela
eased towards long-off for a single to end the over

wild shot from Mahela, a back of length delivery that he skips down and looks to hammer over midwicket, some sound as it passes the batsman, but did it hit his back leg on the way through? Morkel and de Villiers are convinced it is out, the umpire isn't, they don't go for the referral, looks like a good call from the umpire
opens the face and guides the ball towards point
short ball outside off, Mahela wats to upper cut that but he doesn't connect
angles in towards off stump, 140kph, clipped towards square leg
short ball well outside off, 141kph, Dilshan looks to pull that one, hits low on the bat and no timing on the shot either, the ball dribbles towards midwicket
goes for the cut but he can't get bat on ball, it was back of a length and well wide of off stump, moved away a hint as well
length ball is eased towards cover for a single
length ball is punched towards extra cover

once again Mahela goes for the reverse-sweep, he misses and that flighted ball goes between his legs to crashes into the stumps, Peterson is elated, another big strike for South Africa, Sri Lanka in a bit of bother here
full ball outside off and that is driven towards point
flatter and quicker, a touch short, Dilshan waits on the back foot and lashes it towards midwicket, still only one four for Dilshan
full toss from over the wicket, Thirimanne drives it towards long-on for  a single
from round the wicket to the left-hander, 142kph, short of length ball, defended from the crease by Thirimanne
fuller this time, Thirimanne stays in the crease and defends to the off side

short and angled into the body, that struck Thirimanne, who rubs his ribs in pain, looks to pinch a leg-bye as well after the ball rolls towards  short third man, Thirimanne dawdles that run though, AB de Villiers scores a direct hit but Thirimanne has just made it

a huge appeal for lbw as Dilshan is caught on the crease by a short of length ball, umpire turns it down and SA don't review the decision despite that massive shout, it was going to sail over the stumps
short of length once more, guided toward third man for a single
fuller ball, 137kph, clipped towards deep square leg for a single
a leading edge sends the ball towards point, Thirimanne was looking to tuck that to the leg side, the ball doesn't turn as much as Thirimanne expects
goes for a big drive through the off, inside edges it back towards the bowler
steers that in front of point for a single, doesn't look to hit that hard
on leg stump, clipped towards square leg for a single
length ball sliding towards leg stump, worked towards midwicket
on middle and leg, defended towards midwicket
short ball outside off, Dilshan has repeatedly looked to pull these, off the bottom of the bat towards deep midwicket

superb diving catch from AB de Villiers, Morkel has removed the last of the big three, no feet as usual from Dilshan as he went after a wide delivery, nicks it through, de Villiers flies to his right to pouch that one and end a scratchy innings from Dilshan, Sri Lanka in trouble now with two new batsmen in the middle
poor ball from Morkel, a knee-high full toss on the pads, helped towards square leg, a late call for the second and Thirimanne has to dive to make his ground
much more menace from Morkel here, a sharp bouncer that the batsman doesn't know too much about, somehow gets it away to square leg
length ball just outside off, Thirimanne gets behind the line and defends
opens the face to work the full ball towards point for a single
full and flat, blocked towards the bowler
a thick edge as Chandimal looks for the turn, the ball doesn't spin much, gets it away towards square leg, 'Run him out,' screams de Villiers but Chandimal makes his ground
works it towards long-on for a easy single
flighted delivery, Chandimal waits for it and opens the face to guide the ball towards third man
eased towards long-off for a single
full ball on middle and leg, clipped towards deep midwicket
drops it short and just outside off, looks to cut that but can't get it past backward point
slapped towards point this time
full ball on middle stump, watchfully played towards midwicket, du Plessis is quickly onto the ball, Thirimanne wanted a single but seeing the fiedler close in, he changed his mind

length ball on off stump, eased towards a shortish and straight midwicket, would have been a run-out there if du Plessis had got a direct hit, only one stump to aim at, Thirimanne had raced out of the crease initially, had to turn back, luckily for him the throw misses
gives it some air, blocked off the front foot
eased to third man for a single

length ball just outside off, defended towards point, the ball is following du Plessis, he had to dive to stop that one, he looked to lob the ball to the fielder at cover after stopping the ball, the man at cover wasn't anticipating that  though, and the misunderstanding allows a single
length ball on off stump, defended off the front foot
full ball outside off, helped towards deep backward point
short and well outside off, Morris grunts with the effort
shortish ball is blocked by Thirimanne, had to get both feet off the ground to get on top of the bounce, does it well
full and straight, pushed to cover
short of a length, wants to cut, but it is not short enough. Ends up dabbing it to cover
flighted on off, moves forward to drive it to long-off
down the wicket to drive this to the bowler's left
driven to long-on for another single
length ball, middle and leg, defended to midwicket
length ball, on off, driven to mid-off
looks to open the face, gets a fine edge on a shortish delivery, but it doesn't carry to slip
short of a length, nips back in, and this time it hits the inside edge. Goes for a single to fine leg
gets this to hold its line outside off, beats the open face
length ball outside off, pushed to third man with an open face
too straight. Well down the leg side, Chandimal nudges it fine for four

Has he struck first ball? he fires in a full ball that strikes Thirimanne just above the ankle on the back leg after pitching,  umpire says that's out, Thirimanne immediately asks for the review,  given how quickly he asked for the replay, he must have thought he nicked it, there's no Hot Spot here though, some doubt over whether that would have missed the leg stump as well, but the replay says 'umpire's call' and Thirimanne has to go
Mubarak playing his first innings since January 2009, a length ball outside off, moving away and Mubarak is beaten
full and outside off, defended off the front foot
down the leg side, Mubarak looks to glance that and misses
swing and a miss to a short of length ball outside off
full ball heading for middle stump, Mubarak can only block it to the leg side
drops that short, 135kph, Mubaraka bends his knees as he gets out of the way of that one
flighted ball on the leg stump, defended to the leg side
gives it some air again, blocked off the front foot
charges out of the crease and slices that towards deep extra cover, a terrific bit of fielding in the deep from McLaren stops that from reaching the rope
another flighted ball is driven to sweeper cover
gets on the front foot and eases it towards long-on for an ambled single
flighted delivery on off, Chandimal taps it towards cover
short ball down the leg side, another wide
fuller and well outside off, 137kph, driven towards extra cover by Mubarak
short of length ball on the pads, worked towards midwicket for a single
short of length and well outside off, Chandimal reaches across and glides that past slip, not sure he was completely in control of that
length ball heading in towards off stump, defended off the front foot
slower one from Morkel, 121kph, full ball is punched back towards the bowler
angling into the body, Chandimal plays it with soft hands towards midwicket and steals a single

short ball angling down the leg side, it is pulled away towards fine leg, a bit of a top edge, Morne Morkel makes a sliding stop, South Africa's fielding has been better today than it was in the first ODI
more work fro Morkel, has to run to his left this time, concedes the second, de Villiers not too pleased
slides this down the leg side, another free run
short of length ball just outside off, guides it behind point for a single

full ball outside off, Jehan Mubarak plays an elegant drive past extra cover for four, not for nothing did his Cricinfo profile briefly talk about him being potentially the David Gower of Sri Lanka (it doesn't any more)
a fuller delivery from Morris, calmly defended by Mubarak
length ball on off, whipped towards square leg for a single
on the pads once more, flicked behind square leg for a single
strikes him on the gloves, shortish ball just outside off, that rears up and snakes in as well, thuds into his fingers as he looks to leave the ball
length ball on off stump, defended to the leg side
length ball heading for off stump, driven towards mid-on, another dot ball
short and wide from Morkel, a rare loose ball, Chandimal latches on to that, chops it towards backward point but can't get it past du Plessis
short of length on off stump, watchfully defended to the off side, superb over from Morkel
on the pads, Mubarak looks to work it to fine leg but is hit on the pads
slips it down the leg side
and another wicket, Mubarak the man to go now, Duminy sends a flat delivery heading for leg stump, Mubarak chips it back to the bowler, pretty soft dismissal that
was that a drop?hard to tell, Duminy gets the ball to drift in and then spin away, Perera not sure how to play that, might have feathered it through to de Villiers, who can't hang on
flighted delivery is tapped towards cover for a single
flighted and full, driven off the front foot towards cover
spins in from  length, defended from the crease
pushed back towards the bowler, runs hard to come by for Sri Lanka here
length ball on off stump, blocked off the front foot
on off stump, Perera opens the face and guides the ball towards point
he finishes the over with a poor delivery though, well down the leg side, helped along to fine leg, Amla gives chase
length ball on off stump, driven crisply towards extra cover

short ball outside off, Chandimal looks to upper cut that one, the ball is in the air for a while, Amla has to race to his left to cut that off, the bounce surprises him and as he stretches out to grab the ball he loses his balance, he lands badly, on his left knee as well, he takes a long time to get up, de villiers immediately calls for a substitute, let's hope he is fit enough to bat today
wide ball outside off, thick top edge and the ball rolls exactly towards where Amla is lying behind the boundary, being treated by the physio, Aml has to scramble out of the way
short of length ball angling in, gets inside the line of the ball and clips the ball towards midwicket, these are crucial runs on a difficult track
the short ball is pulled away to deep square leg for a single.
length ball heading for middle stump, defended watchfully
opens the face to guide the ball towards cover, du Plesses fires the ball to the keeper's end, Perera put in the dive, but de Villiers breaks the stumps without collecting the ball properly
thrashed towards long-on for a couple
full and on the pads, Perera lashes that behind square leg for four, that was a poor delivery from Phangiso
gets the ball to spin away from Perera this time, leading edge down the  ground

dropped, another mishit from Perera, looking to slog that over long-on, the ball is in the air a long time, Robin Peterson settles under it after running back from mid-on, at least he thinks he has settled under it, he needed to be a couple of paces back though, and he can't hang on to it, he manages to get both hands on it but he was leaning back and had to try take that over his head, he can't
gives it some air, defended to the off side
length ball on off stump, Chandimal whips that towards deep square leg for a single

Perera's chancy stay is over, a short of length ball from Morris, Perera looks to flat bat it out of the park, toe ends it to mid-off, simple catch this time, no one is dropping that, Perera is on his way
short of length ball angling into the body, Herath shuffles across and manages to tap the ball towards short fine leg
fuller one from Morris, punched towards extra cover for a single
shortish ball outside off, defends it towards point
a wristy shot sends a short of length ball towards long-on, nicely played by Herath
short and slow from McLaren, 111kph, Herath moves across and helps the ball along to short fine leg
McLaren gets away with a full toss, it was heading down the leg side as well, Chandimal can only guide it towards fine leg
opens the face and tries to work the ball behind backward point
full and just outside off, dug out towards third man for a single
a slower ball gone horribly wrong, barely pitched on the track though, not one for his highlights reel
a high full toss this time, not above waist high though, punched towards extra cover
this time it is above waist high, a beamer from McLaren, who is clearly struggling with the wet ball, well done to Chandimal for evading that one
back on target this time, a yorker angling in on off stump, kept out by Chandimal
Morkel starts with a typical short of length ball heading for the ribs, Herath manages to defend it
fuller this time, opens the face and steers the ball past point for a single, bringing Chandimal on strike
length ball heading for the pads, sent away behind square leg, Chandimal pushes for the second and gets it

more sensational fielding from South Africa, a diving two-handed catch at backward point ends Chandimal's stay, that was short and wide, Chandimal really got hold of that, lacing it towards backward point, not good enough to get it past du Plessis, though, he's one of the best fielders in the world, and he just showed why he's rated that highly, ends a good innings from Chandimal, not easy scoring on this surface
full ball just outside off, Eranga drives that towards mid-off
back of a length and just outside off, no room for Eranga, who defends the ball to the off side

what a shot from Herath, he's definitely one of the most fun tailenders to watch, her's a flat-batted swat that almost sends that length ball for a six over long-on, bounces a few yards in from the rope
he loves the pull shot, McLaren drops it short, Herath slaps it towards deep midwicket
McLaren's tactic of bowling it short not working here, Eranga swings his arms and sends the ball towards deep square leg, these tailenders having a bit of fun
lashes this towards cover, can't get the placement right though
another full toss form McLaren, about knee-height, worked towards the leg side
Eranga backs away from the stumps and jabs the ball towards point, drops just short of Faf du Plessis
pitched up and outside off, Herath chases that and misses
another ferocious pull from Herath, Petersen fields at deep square leg
looks to push this one towards mid-off, he gets a big inside-edge onto his pads
short ball outside off, not sure he knew what exactly he was doing there, Eranga backs away and somehow manages to get the ball down to third man
a length ball outside off, Eranga moves away from leg and jabs the ball towards sweeper cover
slanting across the batsman who looks to dab that through to third man but misses
short ball is pulled away towards deep backward square leg

a low full toss on legstump, Herath backs away and slices that behind backward point, he wants the second and he sprints back but the throw from the deep is perfect, flat and just above the bails, de Villiers completes the run-out

a short ball that was heading for Malinga's head, Malinga just about manages to evade that, it was short and down the leg side, de villiers dives and gets a glove on it but can't stop the ball completely

inn2.comm: Malinga starts with one of his swinging length deliveries, worked towards square leg by Alviro
on middle stump, 137kph, Alviro tucks that towards fine leg for a single
full and wide outside off, Robin stabs that towards deep point, the outfield is very slow after all the rain, a tag-team effort to field that one near the rope

dropped, Jehan Mubarak's game is getting worse, Alviro was prodding at one outside off, nicks that through to second slip, not the easiest of chances as that came very low to him, still expected to take those at this level, Malinga is not impressed

a swinging yorker leaves Robin on all fours, that was screaming towards Robin's toes, he tries to get his feet out of the way but is struck on the boot and he loses balance, big lbw appeal but that was sliding down leg

this one is not sliding down leg, it is headed for the base of middle stump and is far too good for Robin, no footwork as he tries to negotiate that curling thunderbolt from Malinga, doesn't get bat on it and that crashes into the stumps, Malinga does it again
the ball seaming around here, pitches around off and swerves away, blocked from the crease by Petersen
that one stayed low, it was a length ball well outside off, Petersen looks to chop that towards point but it keeps lower than he expects, gets a bottom edge, bounces through to slip
short of length ball, gets behind the line and defends
when in form Alviro Petersen is a very graceful batsman, he shows us that here, given a short and wide ball, he cuts that away to the point boundary for four
pitching just outside off and moving away a bit, Alviro Petersen defends
huge appeal for lbw but that seemed to be too high, Petersen was struck in front of the stumps as he looked to work the ball to the leg side, struck well above the knee roll
lovely stroke to get going from Duminy, a length ball outside off is crashed between cover and point
drops it short, on leg stump, 140.7kph, Petersen pulls it behind square leg
full ball around off and middle stump, Duminy drives that towards short cover and shouts 'Wait, wait'
swinging down the leg side for a wide
short and wide, carved towards point where Jehan Mubarak moves quickly to his right and then dives to cut that off
full ball swinging towards off, defended towards cover
short from Malinga, tremendous pull from Duminy, gets well on top of the bounce and smashes the ball to the midwicket boundary for four
length ball around off, defended towards mid-on
short of length ball sliding down the leg side, South Africa gave away plenty of free runs, Sri Lanka following suit
another fierce cut shot from Petersen, that was short and wide, powered past point for four
seaming away after pitching outside off, Petersen goes for the cut again, fielded at point this time
nice shape on that ball as Eranga gets it to curl away after bouncing outside off, Petersen shoulders arms
Eranga getting the ball to curve away after bouncing, catching the leading edge as Petersen looks to work the ball from off stump towards the leg side, the ball rolls towards extra cover
slapped towards backward point but can't place it well
back of a length delivery is defended towards short cover
terrific delivery from Pererea, getting the ball to jag away after pitching on off, Duminy is beaten by the movement
not the wisest of shots from Duminy, chasing the ball as it angles away from him, looking to send it down to third man but he's beaten
length ball on the stumps, Duminy gets a good stride in as he defends
back of a length ball, 130kph, mistimed drive towards short cover
width on offer for Duminy, he capitalises, slaps the ball towards sweeper cover, three more overs to go
swinging in towards the pads, full ball is defended towards midwicket
full toss well outside off, should have been put away by duminy, he can only lash it as far as cover though
back of a length ball that instead of coming in towards Duminy, it moves away, Duminy is beaten outside off
length ball well outside off, Duminy doesn't miss out this time, a fierce hit sends that to the sweeper-cover boundary
full ball on the pad,s clipped towards midwicket this time
angling in towards middle and leg stump, Petersen shuffles across and glances that to the fine-leg boundary, easy put away that

Perera gets the breakthrough, he's a wicket-taker this guy, pitching it short of length around off, the ball snakes away just a touch, good bounce there as well, Duminy can only feather it through to the keeper
big lbw appeal first ball, but that was sliding down the leg side
Perera getting the ball to jag in, off the pads and towards midwicket
short of length and outside off, solidly defended thsi time

de Villiers showing why he's among the best in the world, can seem at ease even in the most challenging conditions, waiting for the ball to arrive before unleashing the most graceful of cover drives, sends the ball racing towards the rope, a dive from the fielder near the rope is in vain
just drops the ball towards backward point and sets off for a single
Eranga continues, he starts with a wide delivery outside off, Petersen chases and misses
well outside off once more, Petersen shoulders arms
length ball on off stump, Petersen gets behind the line and defend
beaten outside off, that one starts close to the stumps and moves away, terrific ball that
gets the ball swerving outside off, Petersen happy to allow that to the keeper
too wide outside off stump, Eranga has had the ball moving about but he hasn't been able to control his lines
length ball just outside off, defended back towards the bowler
back of a length ball, 133kph, keeps it around off, de Villiers guides it towards point
a thick inside-edge sends the ball towards square leg, de Villiers was looking to play that through the off side
a bottom edge this time, de Villiers looking to thrash the ball through point, it was short of a length and just outside off, bottom edge was perilously close to the stumps, bounces over though
wide outside off, slapped towards sweeper cover for a single
full ball angling in, Petersen shows us again how stylish he can be, a gorgeous on-drive sends the ball racing to the long-on boundary
Herath is here, starts with a flighted and full ball, on off stump, pushed to long-on for a single
length ball is defended solidly off the front foot
down the leg side, and that will be a wide
length ball outside off, just a bit of turn taking the ball away, defended off the front foot to cover

in his first over, Herath has struck, that looked plumb, Petersen was looking to work the ball to the leg side, it doesn't turn as he expects, goes straight on and he misses it, he is struck low on the pads, that pitched just outside off, struck in front of middle, going on to hit leg, he referred it as well, but to no use, only doubt was whether it was going on to hit, it says 'umpire's call', bye bye Petersen
length ball outside off, du Plessis defended off the front foot towards cover for a quick single
driven on the up towards cover off the front foot, a good start for Herath
length ball that doesn't turn much, defended to the leg side
worked towards backward square leg for a single
a bit of flight from Dilshan, du Plessis tucks that one towards backward square leg for a quick single
length ball outside off, came on slower than de Villiers expected, whipped towards midwicket
full ball is punched towards midwicket, sharp fielding from Chandimal there
spins away after pitching outside off, driven past cover for a single
tossed up, full ball is eased towards long-off for a single
full ball is driven towards extra cover
a touch shorter, slides straight on towards middle stump, defended down the track
drops it a bit short, it's outside off, slapped towards sweeper cover

what a shot that is, superb hit from du Plessis, that was pitched up and outside off, effortlessly driven through cover for four, Malinga was at sweeper cover but he had no chance, timing was top class there, even the slow outfield doesn't stop the ball from reaching the rope

a huge lbw appeal, de Villiers looking to sweep, he misses and is struck on the pads, will they review it? a discussion between Dilshan, Sangakkara and another fielder, they are taking a long time to decide, they have referred it, that pitched just outside off, the doubt was over whether he was struck in line as well, the replays show that he was, and the ball was going on to hit the middle stump, de Villiers is gone, and is that the game as well?
beaten first ball, pushes forward to one that spins sharply outside off
fuller, some more air, wide too, left alone
reaches forward to a flighted ball and drives to extra cover
uppish, uppish drive, drew him into the stroke with lots of air outside off, it goes between cover and extra cover
quicker and spinning into middle and leg, turned to midwicket
skips out but cannot clip this past midwicket
comes out but stops as it dips on a good length, pushes it back
angled across fullish, driven to long off

lovely delivery to get your 50th ODI wicket, Herath tosses it up outside off, sucks him into the drive, has to play at that really, it was close to off stump, spun away to take the edge through to Sanga, who goes up immediately
pushes a full delivery past midwicket
overpitched on the pad, clipped past midwicket
full outside off, driven wide of the sweeper, Malinga stops it with some footwork
tossed up closer to off, blocked
length ball pushed to cover
flat delivery cut to the sweeper
tries to pull but this but it is not short really, mishits down to long on
leans outside off and works it to long on
quick and on a length on middle, played out to point
comes down the track and swats to long off
flat length ball around off whipped to deep midwicket
gets bat  around pad to push nicely but Mubarak at midwicket dives full-length and saves the single
chips out but gets too close to the pitch and drills it along the ground to long on
tosses it up slowly, it does not spin, he comes forward and pushes it back
short ball spins away sharply, slapped towards cover

some amateurish fielding at long-on by Perera, doesn't bend properly as he tries to pick up the ball after doing well to run across, his one-handed attempt is to no avail, the ball slips through for four, it was a powerful swat
flighted delivery just outside off, defended to the off side
on the pads, and that is tucked behind square leg for a single
short of length ball well outside off, driven towards cover
from round the wicket, flat delivery sliding in towards off, defended to the off side
spins in after pitching on a length, driven towards long-on for a single
length ball well outside off, defended off the front foot to the off side
clipped towards long-on, wide enough to get a couple of runs
full ball on off stump, easily worked around here, takes two more to long-on
pitched up and well outside off, driven towards point where Malinga fields
stays on the back foot and pushes the ball towards  long-on for one more
punched towards long-on for one more, South Africa not trying anything extravagant here
pushed towards mid-on this time
lashed towards sweeper cover for a single
spinning away after pitching outside off, slapped towards cover
length ball turns in towards middle stump, defended down the track
short of length ball on middle stump, defended towards the bowler
pitched up and outside off, driven towards cover
drops it a touch short, on middle stump, driven towards cover
looks to glide that one towards third man, he misses and that no runs yet in this over
a groan of frustration from Miller as he misses the ball again, five dot balls so far
on the pads, that is clipped to long leg for a single, superb over from Malinga
Miller shows off his hitting ability, a flat-batted hit to a ball that was back of a length and outside off, easily clears mid-off and races away for four
looking to for the big hit once more, wanted to mow that over midwicket, inside-edges to the pads for a single
length ball on leg stump, clipped towards midwicket for a single
Miller again looking to smash that towards midwicket, comes on quicker than he expects and he misses, the ball rolls towards backward point
length ball on leg stump, McLaren shuffles across and plays a lap sweep, the sluggish outfield means McLaren won't get a boundary
looks to carve that through the off side, it was the standard Perera delivery, back of length and just outside off, he misses
